data.title: Run-of-the-mill coney
data.text: The food and service were decent. The main attraction for us was its proximity to Eastern Market. Not too bad if you're just looking for a breakfast special.

data.title: Needed a Coney fix
data.text: Was pretty good. Probably very good for what it was. Near the eastern market so was convenient to where I was. Looked pretty local.

data.title: Average food, Good Service
data.text: Have been there a couple times for weekend breakfast. Nothing remarkable about the place. Is in a good location for Eastern Market traffic. Service speedy and friendly.

data.title: Gem In Training
data.text: The original Zef's in Eastern Market was a destination for meat packers and astonishing large DFD command officers who barely fit in a booth...no doubt due to the massive meals that they tossed down. I also was a devotee of the generous breakfasts. When I saw the newer Zef's in Midtown, I had to give it a try.  Parking is problem due to the light rails construction but I found a space across Woodward.  The restaurant is a simple affair with tables, booths, but little in the way of decoration.  I opted for the Western omelette and wasn't disappointed.  Since I had recognized the manager from the old Zef's I struck up a conversation and discovered that the original Zef had left the business and she had picked up the new location after recognizing the potential. Once the light rail construction is finished, hopefully business will pick up.  The newness of the operation is reason for the three star rating.

data.title: Gross
data.text:
I work in the building and tried Zef's one time. That was enough. 
The dining area is not very clean so that should have been a red flag.
I ordered breakfast for lunch and it appeared to be going well until I lifted the pancake on the bottom of my stack in order to butter it and found a fairly large hair underneath it. Instantly lost my appetite.
I complained to the waitress who apologized and offered to bring something else to me but my lunch hour was almost up and I didn't have time to wait for anything else. I expected they would remove it from my bill, but they did not, even though it was their fault that I couldn't eat my food. Bad customer service.
Never again.

data.title: Went for a quick dinner left a convert.
data.text:
It goes to show that cheap priced food can be done well and nutritious as well. 
 We had hotdogs and burgers to be sure, with fries, but it was very inexpensive, fresh and service was very efficient. Highly reccomended.
